intro: Arctostaphylos uva-ursi subsp. adenotricha, commonly known as the腺毛熊果, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and leathery, elliptic leaves with glandular hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by red berries that are an important food source for wildlife. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and open forests. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
